post.description:
Creates a session. 
A session refers to the continuous interaction between the user and Powerdrill within a conversation. Your team can have up to 150 sessions simultaneously. If the limit is reached, you can remove unnecessary sessions to make space for new ones.

blocks.content: Check for negative values across all sales columns

- Check for negative values across all sales columns.
- Filter the DataFrame to retain only rows with no negative sales values.
blocks.groupName: Identify the channels with negative sales values by examining each day's sales data. Filter out the rows where any sales value is negative.

blocks.content:
```python

import pandas as pd

def invoke(input_0: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    '''
    input_0: pd.DataFrame  SalesByChannelByDay_Summary_Demo.Sheet1_0_table_1.csv
    '''
    # Identify columns that represent sales data (all except the first column)
    sales_columns = input_0.columns[1:]
    
    # Filter rows where any sales value is negative
    filtered_df = input_0[~(input_0[sales_columns] < 0).any(axis=1)]
    
    # Assign the result to the output variable
    output = filtered_df
    
    return output

```
blocks.groupName: Identify the channels with negative sales values by examining each day's sales data. Filter out the rows where any sales value is negative.

blocks.content: https://s3.amazonaws.com/powerdrilltest/tmp_datasource_cache/code_result/clvl4cad2001q01l1m522hxlu/baf7d6d1-fb81-4fdb-bcdd-32923d214c7b.csv?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20241018T104617Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=599&X-Amz-Credential=AKIARLSQLXURHEIDN4OZ%2F20241018%2Fus-east-1%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=9bcb5af552793f162e35f41d62fb9306cf90888924bfbdce81ea687265fddf83
blocks.groupName: Identify the channels with negative sales values by examining each day's sales data. Filter out the rows where any sales value is negative.

blocks.content:
- Sum the sales across all days for each channel.
- Create a new DataFrame with the channel names and their corresponding total sales.
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the identified channels with negative sales values. This involves summing up the sales across all days for each channel and analyzing the trend.

blocks.content:
```python

import pandas as pd

def invoke(negative_sales_channels: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    '''
    negative_sales_channels: pd.DataFrame  negative_sales_channels.csv
    '''
    # Sum the sales across all days for each channel
    total_sales = negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:].sum(axis=1)
    
    # Create a new DataFrame with the channel names and their corresponding total sales
    output = pd.DataFrame({
        'Channel': negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 0],
        'Total Sales': total_sales
    })
    
    return output

```
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the identified channels with negative sales values. This involves summing up the sales across all days for each channel and analyzing the trend.

blocks.content: https://s3.amazonaws.com/powerdrilltest/tmp_datasource_cache/code_result/clvl4cad2001q01l1m522hxlu/10cffac2-8bf3-45f4-86e6-1ed8457329f2.csv?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20241018T104617Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=600&X-Amz-Credential=AKIARLSQLXURHEIDN4OZ%2F20241018%2Fus-east-1%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=c6f5b522d2ddceea730304b86a45d5f5165f05f9fda3c1d275d11e9022c1e7ac
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the identified channels with negative sales values. This involves summing up the sales across all days for each channel and analyzing the trend.

blocks.content:
- Replace any negative sales values with zero in the data.
- Sum the sales across all days for each channel.
- Create a new data structure with the summed sales values.
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the same channels but excluding the negative sales values. This involves setting negative values to zero or removing them and then summing up the sales across all days for each channel.

blocks.content:
```python

import pandas as pd

def invoke(negative_sales_channels: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    '''
    negative_sales_channels: pd.DataFrame  negative_sales_channels.csv
    '''
    # Replace negative values with zero
    negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:] = negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:].clip(lower=0)
    
    # Sum the sales across all days for each channel
    sales_sum = negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:].sum(axis=1)
    
    # Create a new DataFrame with the summed sales values
    output = pd.DataFrame({
        'Channel': negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 0],
        'Total Sales': sales_sum
    })
    
    return output

```
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the same channels but excluding the negative sales values. This involves setting negative values to zero or removing them and then summing up the sales across all days for each channel.

blocks.content: https://s3.amazonaws.com/powerdrilltest/tmp_datasource_cache/code_result/clvl4cad2001q01l1m522hxlu/f4c99616-dd7c-48b1-8a35-d3141d732c36.csv?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20241018T104617Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=600&X-Amz-Credential=AKIARLSQLXURHEIDN4OZ%2F20241018%2Fus-east-1%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=d21a8d939ab09547bc201754ba253ca6c0d1da5361752f2228237e3ff59be256
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the same channels but excluding the negative sales values. This involves setting negative values to zero or removing them and then summing up the sales across all days for each channel.

blocks.content:
- Merge the two datasets on the 'Channel' column to align sales data for comparison.
- Calculate the difference in 'Total Sales' between the datasets for each channel.
- Store the results, including channel name and calculated difference, in a new dataset.
blocks.groupName: Compare the sales trends with and without negative sales values to determine the impact of negative sales on the overall sales trend for the affected channels.

blocks.content:
```python

import pandas as pd

def invoke(sales_trend_with_negatives: pd.DataFrame, sales_trend_without_negatives: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    # Merge the two DataFrames on the 'Channel' column
    merged_df = pd.merge(sales_trend_with_negatives, sales_trend_without_negatives, on='Channel', suffixes=('_with_negatives', '_without_negatives'))
    
    # Calculate the difference in 'Total Sales' between the two DataFrames
    merged_df['Sales Difference'] = merged_df['Total Sales_without_negatives'] - merged_df['Total Sales_with_negatives']
    
    # Create a new DataFrame to store the results
    output = merged_df[['Channel', 'Sales Difference']]
    
    return output

```
blocks.groupName: Compare the sales trends with and without negative sales values to determine the impact of negative sales on the overall sales trend for the affected channels.

blocks.content:
`Analyzing Conclusions` 

### The impact of negative sales values on overall sales trends

#### Sales variance analysis
blocks.groupName: Conclusions

blocks.content: https://s3.amazonaws.com/powerdrilltest/tmp_datasource_cache/code_result/clvl4cad2001q01l1m522hxlu/aaf4f2f7-e2db-4f2e-98ae-0bdd18f42333.csv?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20241018T104617Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=600&X-Amz-Credential=AKIARLSQLXURHEIDN4OZ%2F20241018%2Fus-east-1%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=19fcfe97c70bf40292b920ecbf0299c101e1de11e49b54fb8f62934b6e874f52
blocks.groupName: Conclusions

blocks.content:
- **Sales variance**：In all channels (including EC, JD, Tmall, WeChat, retail, corporate stores, outlets, and total), the sales difference is 0.0. This indicates that regardless of the presence of negative sales values, the sales trend has not changed.

#### Conclusion and Insights
- **The impact of negative sales values**：Based on the provided data, negative sales values have no impact on the overall sales trend of the affected channels, as the sales variance for all channels is 0.0.
- **Data consistency**：The sales discrepancies across all channels are consistent, indicating that there are no anomalies or deviations caused by negative sales values during data processing or analysis.
blocks.groupName: Conclusions

content: Analyze the specific channels with negative sales values on different dates and discuss whether the sales strategies of these channels might lead to negative values.
Study the long-term impact of negative sales values on overall sales trends and assess whether adjustments to data analysis methods are needed to more accurately reflect the actual situation.
Investigate the source of negative sales values, whether they are related to returns, discounts, or other factors, and propose possible solutions to reduce the occurrence of negative values.

Converses with your data. You can ask anything you want to know from your data.

On Powerdrill, a job represents a task that Powerdrill completes to generate a response to a user-initiated request (such as a prompt or other workflows).

stream.description: Whether to use stream mode. If set to `true`, Powerdrill will send real-time updates to the client, delivering continuous data as it becomes available. If set to `false`, Powerdrill will return the full response only once the entire answer is ready.

question.description: The question you want Powerdrill to answer.

datasetId.description: The ID of the dataset to attach to the session.

datasourceIdList.description: Specifies the IDs of the data sources to use in the conversation, rather than the entire dataset. You can specify up to 1,000 data sources.

languageType.description: The language in which the output is generated.

blocks.content:
- Replace any negative sales values with zero in the data.
- Sum the sales across all days for each channel.
- Create a new data structure with the summed sales values.
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the same channels but excluding the negative sales values. This involves setting negative values to zero or removing them and then summing up the sales across all days for each channel.

blocks.content:
```python

import pandas as pd

def invoke(negative_sales_channels: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    '''
    negative_sales_channels: pd.DataFrame  negative_sales_channels.csv
    '''
    # Replace negative values with zero
    negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:] = negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:].clip(lower=0)
    
    # Sum the sales across all days for each channel
    sales_sum = negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 1:].sum(axis=1)
    
    # Create a new DataFrame with the summed sales values
    output = pd.DataFrame({
        'Channel': negative_sales_channels.iloc[:, 0],
        'Total Sales': sales_sum
    })
    
    return output

```
blocks.groupName: Calculate the overall sales trend for the same channels but excluding the negative sales values. This involves setting negative values to zero or removing them and then summing up the sales across all days for each channel.

blocks.content:
- Merge the two datasets on the 'Channel' column to align sales data for comparison.
- Calculate the difference in 'Total Sales' between the datasets for each channel.
- Store the results, including channel name and calculated difference, in a new dataset.
blocks.groupName: Compare the sales trends with and without negative sales values to determine the impact of negative sales on the overall sales trend for the affected channels.

blocks.content:
```python

import pandas as pd

def invoke(sales_trend_with_negatives: pd.DataFrame, sales_trend_without_negatives: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    # Merge the two DataFrames on the 'Channel' column
    merged_df = pd.merge(sales_trend_with_negatives, sales_trend_without_negatives, on='Channel', suffixes=('_with_negatives', '_without_negatives'))
    
    # Calculate the difference in 'Total Sales' between the two DataFrames
    merged_df['Sales Difference'] = merged_df['Total Sales_without_negatives'] - merged_df['Total Sales_with_negatives']
    
    # Create a new DataFrame to store the results
    output = merged_df[['Channel', 'Sales Difference']]
    
    return output

```
blocks.groupName: Compare the sales trends with and without negative sales values to determine the impact of negative sales on the overall sales trend for the affected channels.

#### Sales variance analysis

blocks.groupName: Conclusions

blocks.content:
- **Sales variance**：In all channels (including EC, JD, Tmall, WeChat, retail, corporate stores, outlets, and total), the sales difference is 0.0. This indicates that regardless of the presence of negative sales values, the sales trend has not changed.

#### Conclusion and Insights
- **The impact of negative sales values**：Based on the provided data, negative sales values have no impact on the overall sales trend of the affected channels, as the sales variance for all channels is 0.0.
- **Data consistency**：The sales discrepancies across all channels are consistent, indicating that there are no anomalies or deviations caused by negative sales values during data processing or analysis.
blocks.groupName: Conclusions

content: Analyze the specific channels with negative sales values on different dates and discuss whether the sales strategies of these channels might lead to negative values.
Study the long-term impact of negative sales values on overall sales trends and assess whether adjustments to data analysis methods are needed to more accurately reflect the actual situation.
Investigate the source of negative sales values, whether they are related to returns, discounts, or other factors, and propose possible solutions to reduce the occurrence of negative values.

post.description:
Creates a data agent.
The data agent will not be active immediately. To activate it, send a **POST** request to the `/v1/subscriptions` API URL, subscribing to a plan of type `AGENT_MODE_PLAN` and setting the `targetId` to the data agent ID.

parameters.name: x-pd-external-trace-id
parameters.description: The external trace ID. The length ranges from 0 to 128 characters.

name.description: The name of the data agent.

template.description: The data agent template to use. Leave it blank or set it to **POWER_AGENT**.

code.title: 业务码
code.description:
Status code. **0** indicates that the operation is successful. Otherwise, the operation fails. Possible error codes include: 
- 100: Bad request. 
- 201: Request frequency limit.
- 9999: Internal error. 
- 100001: Invalid operation.

data.description: Information about the data agent you have created.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The number of pages to display.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items on a single page.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: The data agent template. Set it to **POWER_AGENT**.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The keyword in the data agent names. Data agents whose names match or contain the specified keyword will be returned.

parameters.name: x-pd-external-trace-id
parameters.description: The external trace ID. The length ranges from 0 to 128 characters.

parameters.description: The number of items on a single page.

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description:
The target type. Possible values are:
- `TEAM_WORKSPACE_CAPACITY`: Workspace capacity plans.
- `PROJECT_GENERAL_MODE_PLAN`: Plans for jobs that run in general mode.
- `AGENT_MODE_PLAN`: Plans for jobs that run in data agent mode.

If not specified, subscriptions of all types will be returned.

schema.description:
The order type. Possible values are:
- **WORKSPACE_CAPACITY**: The order placed to subscribe to or purchase Workspace capacity.
- **PROJECT_GENERAL_MODEL_PLAN**: The order placed to subscribe to or purchase data jobs running in general mode.
- **AGENT_PLAN**: The order placed to subscribe to or purchase data jobs running in data agent mode.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Subscription status. Possible values are:
- `incomplete_checkout`: The payment is pending.
- `active`: The subscription is currently active.
- `past_due`: The subscription is overdue but within the grace period.
- `fail`: Subscription failed.

If not specified, subscriptions of all statuses will be returned. 

Multiple statuses can be specified in a comma-separated list, and data sources matching any will be displayed.

paymentMode.description:
The payment mode. Possible values are:
- `ONE_TIME`: A single, upfront payment without recurring charges.
- `RECURRING`: A recurring payment setup, billed at regular intervals (e.g., monthly).

tier.description:
The pricing plan. Possible values vary based on the value of `planType`:
- When `planType` is set to `AGENT_MODE_PLAN`, Possible values are **BASIC**, **PLUS**, and **PRO**.
- When `planType` is set to `WORKSPACE_CAPACITY`, Possible values are **TIER1**, **TIER2**, **TIER3**, **TIER4**, and **TIER5**.
- When `planType` is set to `PROJECT_GENERAL_MODEL_PLAN`, Possible values are **TIER1**, **TIER2**, **TIER3**, **TIER4**, and **TIER5**.

targetType.description:
The target type. Possible values are:
- `TEAM_WORKSPACE_CAPACITY`: Workspace capacity plans.
- `PROJECT_GENERAL_MODE_PLAN`: Plans for jobs that run in general mode.
- `AGENT_MODE_PLAN`: Plans for jobs that run in data agent mode.

curPeriodStartTime.description: The start time of the current billing cycle.

curPeriodEndTime.description: The end time of the current billing cycle.

status.description:
The subscription status. Possible values are:
- `incomplete_checkout`: The payment is pending.
- `active`: The subscription is currently active.
- `past_due`: The subscription is overdue but within the grace period.
- `fail`: Subscription failed.

languageType.title: 输出语言类型
languageType.description: The language in which the output is generated.

maxMessagesInContext.description: The maximum number of messages retained per session.

id.description: The dataset ID, which uniquely identifies the dataset.

code.title: 业务码

Status code. **0** indicates that the operation is successful. Otherwise, the operation fails. Possible error codes include: 
- 100: Bad request. 
- 201: Request frequency limit.
- 9999: Internal error. 
- 100001: Invalid operation.

modelGroup.title: 模型Id
modelGroup.description: The model used for generating responses, for example, **default**.

temperature.description: Specifies the level of randomness in the AI model's responses, ranging from **0** (safer choices) to **1** (more exploratory choices). The default value is **0**.

template.description: The data agent template, which is fixed to **POWER_AGENT**.

targetType.description:
The option of the pricing plan you want to subscribe. Possible values are: 
- `TEAM_WORKSPACE_CAPACITY`: If you want to subscribe to or purchase Workspace capacity, use this option.
- `PROJECT_GENERAL_MODE_PLAN`: If you want to subscribe to or purchase data jobs that run in general mode, use this option.
- `AGENT_MODE_PLAN`: If you want to subscribe to or purchase data jobs that run in data agent mode, use this option.

tier.description:
The pricing plan. Possible values vary based on the value of `planType`:
- When `targetType` is set to `AGENT_MODE_PLAN`, Possible values are **BASIC**, **PLUS**, and **PRO**.
- When `targetType` is set to `TEAM_WORKSPACE_CAPACITY`, Possible values are **TIER1**, **TIER2**, **TIER3**, **TIER4**, and **TIER5**.
- When `targetType` is set to `PROJECT_GENERAL_MODE_PLAN`, Possible values are **TIER1**, **TIER2**, **TIER3**, **TIER4**, and **TIER5**.

paymentMode.description:
The payment mode. Possible values are:
- `ONE_TIME`: A single, upfront payment without recurring charges.
- `RECURRING`: A recurring payment setup, billed at regular intervals (e.g., monthly).
